alert.note: Alert for Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:55PM CDT until July 21 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR WICHITA COUNTY... At 1054 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Modoc, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...The Automated Weather Observing Site in Tribune measured a 71 mph gust at 922 PM MDT/1022 PM CDT/. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Leoti, Lydia, Selkirk and Marienthal. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
